SENT.plain: A 32-year-old primigravida showed signs of pre-eclampsia before delivery of a healthy boy at term
The CSF-space was accidentally punctured during epidural anaesthesia in labour
One day later hypertension was noted and the patient had a single generalized fit
For the next three weeks she had postural headaches, fluctuating hypertension, intermittent hearing loss and double-vision

On the 22nd day of postpartum, the patient had the first of a series of partial and later generalized seizures, followed by hemiparesis, alteration of consciousness, and finally slow recovery with corticosteroid therapy
Bilateral subdural effusions and generalized meningeal thickening were found on MR scans
Repeated MRI excluded sinus thrombosis and documented the response to treatment
